CDISC Notes: Unique identifier for a study within the submission.
Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
Unique subject identifier within the submission.

Sequence Number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain.
May be any valid number.
Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.
Internal or external identifier such as label number.

Sponsor-defined reference number. Perhaps pre-printed on the CRF as an explicit
line identifier or defined in the sponsor’s operational database. Examples: Line number on the Drug Accountability page, drug label code.

Short character value for DATEST used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. The short value can be up to 8 characters and cannot begin with a number or contain characters other than
letters, numbers or underscores. Example: DISPAMT, RETAMT.

Verbatim name, corresponding to the topic variable, of the test or examination used to obtain the drug accountability assessment. The value in DATEST cannot
be longer than 40 characters. Example: Dispensed Amount, Returned Amount.

Used to define a category of related records. Examples: STUDY MEDICATION,
RESCUE MEDICATION.
Used to define a further categorization level for a group of related records.
Result of the Drug Accountability assessment as originally received or collected.
Unit for DAORRES.

Contains the result value for all Drug Accountability assessments, copied or derived from DAORRES in a standard format or in standard units. DASTRESC should store
all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in DASTRESN.
Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from DASTRESC. DASTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
Standardized units used for DASTRESC and DASTRESN.

Used to indicate that a drug accountability assessment was not done. Should be
null or have a value of NOT DONE.
Reason not done. Used in conjunction with DASTAT when value is NOT DONE.

1. Clinical encounter number.
2. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

1. Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter
2. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY
Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.

1. Study day of drug accountability assessment, measured as integer days.
2. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.
